DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Distant Metastasis M Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for the colon and rectal cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to clinlcal M stage of a colorectal tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8-28-19 ownership transfer approved by CTEP/B.Campbell; tmt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical M Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of colorectal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer cM1b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer cM1b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with metastases in more than one organ/site or the peritoneum. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer cM1b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with metastases in more than one organ/site or the peritoneum. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer cM1a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer cM1a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis confined to one organ or site (e.g., liver, lung, ovary, nonregional node). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer cM1a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis confined to one organ or site (e.g., liver, lung, ovary, nonregional node). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of colorectal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer Clinical Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of colorectal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
